meanings.definition: A person or thing that flushes.
meanings.sent1: The dog acted as the flushers during the hunt, chasing the birds out of the bushes.
meanings.sent2: The automatic toilet flushers in the public restroom help maintain cleanliness.
meanings.sent3: The little robot vacuum was a helpful flushers, cleaning up all the crumbs on the floor.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter worked like a flushers, clearing the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter was a brave flushers, rushing into the burning building to save lives.

meanings.definition: A device used to flush waste material.
meanings.sent1: The toilet flushers in our house are very efficient and save water.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to press the flushers after using the portable camping toilet.
meanings.sent3: The automatic pet waste flushers made cleaning the backyard much easier.
meanings.sent4: The river acted like a natural flushers, carrying away all the debris downstream.
meanings.sent5: The factory installed new flushers to improve the waste disposal system.

meanings.definition: A person who flushes out game for hunters.
meanings.sent1: The flushers guided the hunters through the dense forest, tracking the deer.
meanings.sent2: The experienced flushers knew how to startle the birds from their hiding spots.
meanings.sent3: The young flushers accidentally scared away the rabbits before the hunters could aim.
meanings.sent4: The wind acted as a natural flushers, blowing the scent of the prey towards the hunters.
meanings.sent5: The skilled flushers could anticipate the movement of the game and lead the hunters to success.
